Package Main.Scores

Class Highscore

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
Main.Scores.Highscore
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class Highscore
extends javax.swing.JComponent
Public class Highscore is responsible for generating and showing the top 10 highest scores for each level and the total highscore for the game on the Highscore Board which can be reached from the HomeMenu. Every time the highscore lists are loaded, they are first resorted using the comparator. Then, the list is renumbered according to the new ordering. Although the lists are not expected to have any issue in the ranking since they are already resorted in another class, these 2 actions serve to act as a precaution in case there is an unexpected issue with the highscore lists.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Highscore

      public Highscore​(GameFrame owner, java.awt.Dimension area) throws java.io.IOException
      This constructor is used to create a menu face to display the highscores for each level and the total highscores for the game. Buttons are also created and assigned to mouse listeners to detect mouse clicks and to load other highscore pages or to return to the HomeMenu.
      Parameters:
      owner - This GameFrame is used to link to HighScore so that HighScore can access ite methods.
      area - This is the size of the HomeMenu and is used to load HighScore with the same size.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This test throws IOException if HighScore background does not exist.

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the HighScore.
      Overrides:
      paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - This graphics class is used to paint the HighScore.

    • drawScoreBoard

      private void drawScoreBoard​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the HighScore.
      Parameters:
      g2d - This graphics class is used to paint the HighScore.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This IOException is thrown if the highscore list does not exist.

    • drawText

      private void drawText​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d, int level) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the text of the Highscore such as the player ranking, name, category, time and score.
      Parameters:
      g2d - This graphics class is used to paint the text of Highscore.
      level - This is the level for which the current highscore list is showing for.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This IOException is thrown if the highscore list does not exist.

    • drawButton

      private void drawButton​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
      This method is responsible for painting and repainting the buttons of Highscore.
      Parameters:
      g2d - This graphics class is used to paint the buttons of Highscore.

    • Load

      private void Load​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> loadScore, int level) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method is used to load the highscore lists into linked lists so that the top 10 highscores for each level and the total highscore for the game can be shown.
      Parameters:
      loadScore - The linked list where the highscore list is loaded into.
      level - This is the level for which the highscore list is loaded.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This IOException is thrown if the highscore list does not exist.

    • Renumber

      private void Renumber​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> holdScore)
      This method is called to renumber the linked list after resorting it. The new rankings will be in ascending order in increments of 1 starting from 1.
      Parameters:
      holdScore - The linked list which is to be renumbered.

    • RemoveDuplicates

      private void RemoveDuplicates​(java.util.LinkedList<Score> holdScore)
      This method removes any duplicate entries in the rankings. The method checks for the same player name, score and level type and leaves only a single entry. Since this method is called after the rankings are resorted, only the best scores and best times for a person in each category is kept.
      Parameters:
      holdScore - The linked list where the duplicate entries are to be removed.
